Introduction and summary. Of fundamental importance to the theory of ideals in commutative rings satisfying the ascending chain condition for ideals has been the works of Noether [6] and Krull [4] . What follows, in the first two sections, is an attempt to extend more of the Krull-Noether theory of commutative rings to one-sided ideals in noncommutative rings. A decomposition theory for one-sided ideals in the noncommutative case was provided by Fitting [l] . Although Fitting was able to prove uniqueness theorems in certain cases, he did not prove uniqueness theorems for arbitrary noncommutative rings satisfying the ascending chain condition for right ideals. By methods based on the works of Noether and Fitting, we shall prove decomposition and uniqueness theorems for arbitrary noncommutative rings with identity that satisfy the ascending chain condition for right ideals. Actually, the theorems in this paper are proved for what we define to be A-R modules, which is a generalization of noncommutative rings. In the third section, we discuss completely indecomposable A-R modules, which follow along the lines of a paper by Snapper [7] . A sufficient condition for two faithful representations of a noncommutative ring with identity to be equivalent follows from this discussion.
